content.description: This crack between The Places You'll Go & Crescent Moonwalk has tons of face holds make this a great route for the beginning trad leader. No need to clip those bolts if you dont want to....
content.protection: Small to medium; use Crescent Moonwalk anchors (to the right)- 2 Metolious rap hangers.  Note that the anchors to the left, at the top of The Places You'll Go, have one Metolious rap hanger and one Fixe hanger (do not rap from this!), so you'll be rapping from one bolt if you go to the left anchors....
content.location: The crack in between the two routes mentioned above, which are fully described and photo'd in the Todd Goss guidebook

content.description: Ugh.  Located  between The Lorax and The Places You'll Go this is a hard to protect offwidth.  Ignore the abundant bolts if you are so inclined.  Use common sense: this is 5.8 ow not 5.8 sport.
content.protection: You can get a small C3 before you enter the depths, and an orange metolious master cam in the depths as well as a yellow C3 and then a big #6 BD way up high.  That's it.
content.location: This is the wide crack right of The Lorax and left of The Places You'll Go...

content.description: The route is probably the most interesting 5.10a in the Cedar city area.  Starts by scrambling up blocks to straight forward layback moves before stepping across a large crack onto the main face. Heads up main face on good edges and pockets. The entire face slowly twisting making the face look like it came out of a Dr. Suess book.
content.location:
Located on the Suess Wall. Bolt line shares start with 2 other routes before departing far left.

to locate the Suess wall continue left down the trail after it opens up at the scree field for about 50 yards before heading up the scree. Look for 3 routes a that share the first 4 bolts.

content.description: Climb up the same few bolts for the Lorax but stay direct and climb the face in between the two cracks. Not great rock down low but the second half is great.
content.location: Climb up the same few bolts for the Lorax but stay direct and climb the face in between the two cracks.
